attributes.action: Abolish the standing charges on Electricity and Gas supply to homes
attributes.additional_details:
These charges are unfair and create energy poverty for people who are struggling with the decision wether to heat or eat. 
  Householders are now paying up to 90p per day for just having a connection, regardless wether it’s even switched on at the mains. 
  This cannot be justified and must be stopped.
attributes.background: Force energy suppliers to abolish standing charges on domestic energy accounts

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you
